hook.text: Gitcoin DAO funds open-source software through community grants. It has distributed over $50 million to builders.

buildup.text: Using quadratic funding, small donations are amplified by a matching pool. Popular projects get more, proportionally.

discovery.text: Quadratic funding favors breadth over depth. A project with 1,000 $1 donations beats one with a single $50,000 gift.

twist.text: Sybil attacks â€” fake accounts making small donations â€” threatened the system. Identity verification became essential.

climax.text: Gitcoin pioneered democratic funding for public goods. Its model is studied by economists and governments worldwide.

punchline.text: A DAO that funds code for the public good, chosen by the crowd.

quiz.question: How does Gitcoin's quadratic funding work?
options: Projects with many small supporters receive proportionally more matching funds
